title: What is the home tone of the major keys? - Quora

response.answer_text: The ‘Home tone’ is the tone with the lowest tension, where the melody feels the most at ease, most relaxed. A melody often starts out on this note and almost always ends here. A scale would begin on this tone. As the steps of a scale (and especially the chords/triads build on them) are refered to with Roman numbers, we could call the first step of the scale ‘i’. Another name (especially in classical or European termibology) is the ‘tonic’. But I like your term: ‘home tone’. If the first note/i/tonic/home feeling in a key is the tone A - voila, we are in the key of A. That’s exactely why this specific key is given this letter as part of its name.
The home tone of A major is A. The home tone of Bb major is Bb. The home tone of B major is B. The home tone of C major is C Perhaps you can figure the others by yourself..
